body:
> I think the issue is that the Selenium tests aim to click on the select options to alter the form values and go from there, so if we had our own secret select somewhere on the page, we'd have to fire changes in both directions.

Yeah, but Ant just passes down an `onChange` prop and a `value` prop to wrapped form inputs. My thought was that the wrapper would forward those props to both the Ant select and the native select, which would handle the back-and-forth sync between the two (since `value` will update when the value changes).
